DOC.brief_summary: RATIONALE : An outpatient educational behavioral skill train program may help patient metastatic breast prostate cancer live long comfortably . PURPOSE : This randomized clinical trial study whether outpatient educational behavioral skill train program improve pain control patient metastatic recurrent breast prostate cancer .
DOC.brief_title: Pain Control Patients With Recurrent Metastatic Breast Prostate Cancer
DOC.detailed_description: OBJECTIVES : - Evaluate feasibility implement outpatient education behavioral skill train program pain control multi-institution setting . - Evaluate whether patient education behavioral skill train improve cancer pain control patient recurrent metastatic breast prostate cancer . - Amend protocol , approval Division Cancer Prevention Control , groupwide 3-arm study analysis demonstrate feasibility potential efficacy patient education behavioral skill train program . OUTLINE : This randomize study . Patients stratify accord diagnosis ( breast v prostate cancer ) , initial `` pain bad '' score ( 4-6 v 7 high ) , participate institution . Patients randomize 1 2 treatment arm . - Arm I : Patients receive standard pain management . - Arm II : Patients receive educational intervention ( booklet , audiotape , videotape ) behavioral skill training ( include schedule practice relaxation session ) addition standard pain management . Patients receive follow-up phone call within 48-72 hour intervention review pain status . Patients arm undergo pain psychological assessment day 1 15 . PROJECTED ACCRUAL : A total 96 patient ( 48 per arm ) accrue study .
